Sequence Information.Peptide Name: YD1 (natural AMPs; Gly-rich; bacteriocin, bacteria, prokaryotes; BBN)

Literature Information.Literature: APD analysis reveals that the sequence of THE PEPTIDE shows 40% similarity toLeucrocin I. Active against Gram- S. typhimurium KCTC 1925 (MIC 32 ug/ml), E. coli KCTC 1923 (MIC 8 ug/ml), P. aeruginosa KCTC 1637 (MIC 16 ug/ml), Gram+ M. smegmatis ATCC 9341 (MIC 8 ug/ml), S. aureus KCTC 1928, MRSA B15 (MIC 32 ug/ml), E. faecalis ATCC 29212 (MIC 64 ug/ml), B. subtilis ATCC 6633 (MIC 64 ug/ml), M. luteus ATCC 9341 (MIC 64 ug/ml), VRE 2, and VRE5 (MIC 64 ug/ml) (anti-VRE). YD1 binds to the plasmid DNA of E. coli (Rahman M et al., 2017).Updated 2/2017; 10/2024.
Literature Information.Author: Rahman MS, Choi YH, Choi YS, Yoo JC.2017
Literature Information.Title: Glycin-rich antimicrobial peptide YD1 from B. amyloliquefaciens, induced morphological alteration in and showed affinity for plasmid DNA of E. coli.
